titleStmt.title: Whereas information is given unto us the Lords Justices and Council, that divers great summes of money have been of late secretly conveyed, and transported out of this kingdom, contrary to the laws and statutes now in force prohibiting the same, to the great impoverishing of the realm, and final consumption to the treasure thereof, if not speedily prevented ... by the Lords Justices and Council, Mich. Dublin, c., Art. Forbese.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Boyle, Michael, 1609?-1702.
Granard, Arthur Forbes, Earl of, 1623-1696.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Benjamin Tooke ... and are to be sold by Joseph Wilde ...,

notesStmt.note: Title from first 8 lines of text.
Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
"Given at the Council-chamber in Dublin the six and twentieth day of July, 1675."
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
